description: From moon +‎ calf, after a superstition that the moon caused abnormal fetal development.

entries.meaning: (now rare) An abnormal mass within the uterus; a false conception. [from 16th c.]
A poorly-conceived idea or plan. [from 17th c.]
A dreamer, someone absent-minded or distracted; a fool, simpleton. [from 17th c.]
examples: “ […]  you’re a jobbernowl and a doodle, a maundering mooncalf and a blockheaded numps, a gaby and a loon; you’re a Hatter!” I shrieked the last epithet.
